name: TV Series That Became Movies Trivia Quiz | TV & Movies Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who starred as Mrs. Brady in the movie version of "The Brady Bunch"?
questions.explanation:
Shelley Long.

	I'm told that this movie - like most of the movies in this category - was a bomb.

questions.text: In the movie version of "Superman", who uttered the lines : "You've got me? Who's got you?"
questions.explanation:
Lois Lane.

	Margot Kidder's best role. Good movie.

questions.text: Who starred in the movie version of "The Saint"?
questions.explanation:
Val Kilmer.

	The TV show with Roger Moore was fine. As for the movie ...

questions.text: Which villain appeared in the movie version of "Batman"?
questions.explanation:
The Joker.

	Jack Nicholson in the role (with Michael Keaton as Batman).

questions.text: Which of these actresses starred in the movie version of "The Beverly Hillbillies"?
questions.explanation:
Cloris Leachman.

	Sometimes it's best not to say anything at all.

questions.text: Don Adams reprised his role as Maxwell Smart in a movie that was based on the TV series. In the movie, the "threat" was from a bomb that had been developed. What did the bomb destroy?
questions.explanation:
Clothing.

	They called it "The Nude Bomb". The critics agreed with the last word.

questions.text: Who starred in the movie version of "The Addams Family"?
questions.explanation:
Anjelica Huston.

	With the late Raul Julia.

questions.text: Klinton Spillsbury (no kidding) starred in a movie version of "The Lone Ranger". What was the name of Tonto's horse (in the TV series)?
questions.explanation:
Scout.

	Cochise was the horse that belonged to Little Joe in "Bonanza". Trigger belonged to Roy Rogers. As for "Kemo Sabe", there wasn't an episode of the TV series that didn't have Tonto address the Ranger with this term.

questions.text: The movie version of "The Twilight Zone" is best remembered for the tragic accident that claimed the life of actor Vic Morrow. How did he die?
Who starred in the movie version of 1998 version of "The Avengers"?
questions.explanation:
Ralph Fiennes.

	Patrick Macnee was fine in the TV version. Diana Rigg was memorable.
